result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashawna Jarnell Brown

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
STC for 10/24/22 adjourned to 11/14/22 at 3:00 pm on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date. Clerk spoke with DE on the phone and new notice sent.

03:22 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Lashawna Jarnell Brown, appeared.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: DE is requesting additional time so she may retain an attorney. The State will not object to one more adjournment, but will request a trial date at the next hearing. Court adjourns.  Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court is no longer available in the AM court contacted the defendant and she is requesting more time to obtain counsel as she is not eligible for SPD and has to work on Wednesday.  ADA Smathers does not object to her request for adjournment and DE states her off days are on Mondays and Tuesdays.
re: Judicial rotation mailed to DE
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

CONTINUED POSTED
  PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.

02:29 PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:20 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $600  Cash bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry).  Cash bond on deposit $600.  ts
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
